name: MANSPOT Manscape Groin & Body Hair Trimmer for Men, Electric Ball Trimmer Pubic Trimmer Shaver,Manscape Kit with 4 Guard,Replaceable Ceramic Blade Heads,Waterproof Wet/Dry Shaver,90 Minutes Shaving
about_this_item: Ultra-Smooth Shaving: Upgrade your grooming routine with MANSPOT Groin Pubic Body Hair Trimmer. Bid farewell to traditional shavers' discomfort and pain as our anti-cut blade and high-power motor deliver a faster, smoother, and more comfortable shave. No more nicks or burns, just a clean and confident look.

Special Care for Your Precious Jewels: The blade is made from Aerospace-Grade materials, ensuring a safer and more reliable manscape grooming experience. You deserve the best care for your most delicate area, and that's exactly what the MANSPOT manscape ball/pubic/groin trimmer provides. Stretch out your skin and go slowly and steadily for the best results, and experience a new level of comfort and care.

Long-Lasting and Rechargeable: Welcome to the Environmental Enthusiasts Club! Save time and money with the MANSPOT body trimmer. With up to 20 uses on a single charge, it's a durable and reliable choice for all your grooming needs. Featuring electric trimmer guards with four lengths (1.5mm, 3mm, 3-6mm, 9-12mm), it suits any trimming preference. The 1.5mm guard is ideal for those who prefer a very close trim or shave.

Ergonomic Design & Waterproof: MANSPOT manscape trimmer's sleek design ensures an easy grip, even when wet. Its waterproof feature allows for convenient use in the shower or bath, making it your go-to grooming tool for back hair, chest hair, pubic hair, bikini hair, and underarm hair.

VALENTINES DAY GIFT FOR HIM: GQ Recommends-This Valentine's Day, delight the men you cherish with the ideal gifts that speak to their hearts. Show your significant other with a considerate Valentine's Day gift, bringing happiness and comfort into his world.

title: Feels cheap, came covered in mold - updated
content: This is a first impression review, and as first impressions go this wasn’t great. The product box was covered in a type of shrink wrap that upon opening had an *extremely* strong medicinal odor. Upon further inspection the trimmer itself, box, and accessories, were covered in patches of white mold (see photos) and the trimmer was somehow wet?? This is extremely offputting for a personal care product, and speaks to the companies quality control and storage practices.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: The trimmer itself has that classic Chinese plastic cheap feel, which is ironic considering how far the company has gone to present themselves as an American product, Writing “Established in Missouri” and being sure to note that the founders name is ostensibly American (Gordon) while containing a quintessentially Chinese product and broken English manuals. The trimmer also has poor weight distribution. It’s front heavy while the base of the plastic handle feels empty. The guards don’t feel like they’ll last long in that they are brittle with slight flex, but will evidently snap in half if flexed too often. I will update this review once I’ve used the trimmer several times, but so far I would suggest skipping this item, it’s Chinese junk that’s clearly been sitting in a warehouse for years.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I've been a practicing barber for decades.  I became one in my late teens and now I'm retired.  I know about edgers well.  The industry likes to over-charge women because they know we're used to buying beauty products and they mark intimate edgers up by 20% or more.  I know this, so I decided to try this product even though it's for men.  I was not expecting much but I'm tired of buying edgers that bite.  Even with my discount, a Wahl product is going to be $60 or more.  I'm on a budget now and have to make choices differently than I did when I was standing behind the chair.  I figured at this price, I use once and throw it out, I still got a deal.  First of all, the ergonomics of this product are awesome.  Second, I'm used to a very close shave being a barber.  I will say this will not give you that but who cares?  My expectations are not like yours are.  This still provides a close shave.  It is quiet and the power is much lower than I'm used to but it works!  My only suggestions are...be careful not to drop this.  It's got a ceramic blade and I'm not sure it would survive it.  Pull the skin with your other hand (a flat palm). when shaving for a close shave.  We're taught that in barber school.  You will have to go over a section at least three times for a close shave.  Mine did not include a brush to clean but in my industry we use several brushes... but my favorite will always be a tint brush.  It is a brush we use to apply color to the scalp.  You can put "tint brush for color application" in the search bar of Amazon and you can find one for a few dollars.  We're taught to clean our edgers and clippers after every client.  I would suggest you clean it with a brush after every use and store the edgers in a place where it will not be prone to dropping it, like a drawer.  My score for this product as a professional, is a "9."  You won't be disappointed.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
content: First I'll say that I do like this trimmer overall. It is quiet. It hums, but its quieter than an exhaust fan. It is very sharp and cuts even my coarse chest hair with ease. I'm a very hairy person, and I don't want to be anymore. I use it with the length combs to trim my chest, my hands, arms, neck, and my legs. I use it to completely shave "down below". So I've learned a few things after using this trimmer a few times. First, it cuts very close but leaves stubble. So it works great for taking off a lot of hair or keeping hair trimmed with the included length combs. (I had pics of my chest, but my phone crashed and I lost them). The combs do get clogged with hair when trimming long hair for the first time. Main things I have learned; keep the head flat against the skin, go against the grain for closest cut, take your time trimming intimate areas. And the number one thing, when you are trimming your scrotum(sack, nads, whatever), go ACROSS the ridges and wrinkles. DO NOT run the trimmer with the ridge. It will draw the skin in-between the teeth and cut the hell out your sack. Even if you are using a guard. I cut myself the first time, so next time I used the short guide. Still cut me, just not as bad. Pull the skin tight when possible. Use your thumb to pull the skin and your fingers to push up on your nads to stretch the skin. Whatever you can do to keep the skin tight helps a lot. When you can not do this, trim slow and careful and ACROSS the ridges and wrinkles. I can't stress that enough.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2023

title: Verified Purchase
